title: make words with lights from building
content:
Hi, I’m trying to make words on a buidling by getting people to switch on and off their lights, anyone know what would be the best kind fo font etc for something like this.. I have had a bit of a try on hotoshop only at mo, and it’s hard...the building is Bewick court in Newcastle, if you google the block, you can see lots of images... I can;t really find a way for a B etc... Also at mo I can only get four letters on the side of the buidling, so fonts that could be made using less windows would be great..thanks in advance for any help as feel a bit lost in it all.. anton

 [‹ Just one more novel question](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/typophile.com/node/50667 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font help for Interiors/Homes magazine ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/typophile.com/node/44291 "Go to next forum topic")
author: antnhec

comments.content: I don’t think any font would specifically meet your needs. What you need to do is grid out the windows/lights on each building and then build bitmap letters. A grid 3 wide by 5 high can get you most of the letters, though some will require a wider grid.

German Fontblog recently had [an article](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/www.fontblog.de/blinkenlights-in-toronto-erfolgreich-gestartet) about the [Blinkenlights project](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Blinkenlights) in [Toronto](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/blinkenlights.net/stereoscope).  
 [Verena Gerlach](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Verena%252BGerlach) had designed fonts for the Berlin Blinkenlights project, back in 2001. You can get them for free at [Primetype](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045819/http:/www.primetype.com/free_fonts.php).  
F

Do I understand correctly that each pair of little windows looks into the same room and therefore comprises one pixel? That makes it 7 wide by 19 tall. Can you tell us what the message is you want to send? I can probably help come up with something.
the message is going to be a number of words, that will be part of a poem, that I have yet to write... thanks for all the really useful advice..

Here’s what I suggest. This took me a few seconds. You can use it to write each word down the side of the building sideways.
